00016 namespace MWRender
00017 {
00018   // This class keeps track of the player position. It takes care of
00019   // camera movement, sound listener updates, and collision handling
00020   // (to be done).
00021   class PlayerPos
00022   {
00023     ESMS::LiveCellRef<ESM::NPC, MWWorld::RefData> mPlayer;
00024     MWWorld::Ptr::CellStore *mCellStore;
00025     Ogre::Camera *camera;
00026     MWWorld::World& mWorld;
00027 
00028   public:
00029     PlayerPos(Ogre::Camera *cam, const ESM::NPC *player, MWWorld::World& world) :
00030       mCellStore (0), camera(cam), mWorld (world)
00031     {
00032         mPlayer.base = player;
00033         mPlayer.ref.pos.pos[0] = mPlayer.ref.pos.pos[1] = mPlayer.ref.pos.pos[2] = 0;
00034     }
00035 
00036     // Set the player position. Uses Morrowind coordinates.
00037     void setPos(float _x, float _y, float _z, bool updateCamera = false);
00038 
00039     void setCell (MWWorld::Ptr::CellStore *cellStore)
00040     {
00041         mCellStore = cellStore;
00042     }
00043 
00044     Ogre::Camera *getCamera() { return camera; }
00045 
00046     // Move the player relative to her own position and
00047     // orientation. After the call, the new position is returned.
00048     void moveRel(float &relX, float &relY, float &relZ)
00049     {
00050       using namespace Ogre;
00051 
00052       // Move camera relative to its own direction
00053       camera->moveRelative(Vector3(relX,0,relZ));
00054 
00055       // Up/down movement is always done relative the world axis.
00056       camera->move(Vector3(0,relY,0));
00057 
00058       // Get new camera position, converting back to MW coords.
00059       Vector3 pos = camera->getPosition();
00060       relX = pos[0];
00061       relY = -pos[2];
00062       relZ = pos[1];
00063 
00064       // TODO: Collision detection must be used to find the REAL new
00065       // position.
00066 
00067       // Set the position
00068       setPos(relX, relY, relZ);
00069     }
00070 
00071         MWWorld::Ptr getPlayer()
00072         {
00073             MWWorld::Ptr ptr (&mPlayer, mCellStore);
00074             return ptr;
00075         }
00076   };
00077 }
